relation: Great for these types of students
Share any unusual traditions or locations on campus
they work really hard to keep people here safe ill give it a 97% safe rate good, theres till drugs and alcohal.
there are many clubs here that you can join but i'm not in any of them because i just don't have the time.
this college supports guys and lesbian's, this college is great for people that don't talk much and the people here are pretty friendly.
this college is to much and i don't get enough money to stay.
i sleep in on weekends and i go to the gym or do my homework, some times i go to the movies if i have an extra 4 bucks.
they serve the same thing every week the food is all right but the price is more then what you could buy food off campuss witch is not right i have a meal plan that comes out of my finacle aid .

the heights are the ghetto for hocking college there the older dorms but they are nicer then the newer dorms the people are nice but paying for the dorms are to much its 2,500 per quarter that's almost all of my finical aid.

wilderness horsemanship, is a great field to go in because its hands on, the teachers are nice and the classes are small there's on like 10 to 15 people in a class witch means you can get help from the teacher if you need it.
go to class, get up in time, eat right, do my homework, get what ever finical or loans you can get.

hocking college is a great school and there are many fields to go in. i am i wilderness horsemanship they have many horses over here to work with they will even let to bring your own horse. hocking college reminds me of home with the people and the surrounding's.

textAfterTable: The faculty here at the school are the best. They are nice and helpful. And will make sure and do anything to make sure you pass. Tips for prospective students Stay on top of you studies and homework. It really makes a difference and you feel more accomplished. Plus, you can look back and say I did that. I finished college. In three sentences Going to Hocking College is one of the best choices I have ever made in my life. The location is beautiful and there is a lot of outdoor activities to do. Also, the faculty and staff are super nice and super helpful when you do ask for help and provides hands-on learning. Which a lot of other colleges do not. Login to rate or flag the reviews Mark from Nelsonville, OH 01/13/2011 Reviewer is A past student here. 1 out of 3 people found this review useful. 3 of 34 Categories Comments Bang for the buck
